issue.title: Recent changes to libassimp-dev v3 break existing Groovy packages like geometric_shapes.

content.raw: Sorry, I thought I was logged into Bitbucket (I usually always am).  geometric_shapes and a variety of other packaes use libassimp v2.  They have assimp v2 headers in their headers.  So, if you build against these, it assume the v2 headers exist.  Ubuntu will happily allow libassimp 2 and 3 to be installed, but the -dev package for v3 cannot live beside the v2 one.  So, by forcing us to upgrade to v3, you are breaking compatability with long-standing packages like geometric_hapes, which we use to filter out points that fall onto the Atlas body (assuming we can read the meshes, which doesn't work with geometric shapes unless those are STL files -- waiting for that fix in 3.1.1).
